III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 400.4131 Reviewed facility policy and informed Chief Administrator that
staff who witness incidents of abuse/neglect should be the ones who complete
incident reports and contact Centralized Intake.
• Rule 400.4150 Notification of Hospitalization, law enforcement contact, and
AWOL, ensure that parent, worker, consultant are contacted as soon as
possible no later than 24 hours.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was required or requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the individual CAP is as follows: The
special investigation 2024SIC00001743 dated 11/19/2024 was investigated by
DCWL. This involved a youth swallowing a razor, and the agency did not seek
medical attention immediately. To this date the agency has been compliant with
the CAP. The policy was revised and reviewed, and all staff have been retrained
on the new policy.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the facility’s
budget and financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable

Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was done on time and was comprehensive and
reviewed the area of noncompliance from the special investigation. There are no
citations from the interim inspection in 2024 that were cited as repeat citations in
this renewal inspection.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by supervisor and upper
management. They said the facility and staff’s main goal is ensuring the safety
and well-being of the youths
The youths interviewed reported feeling safe and expressed no issues or
concerns regarding staff or the facility. Youths stated they have enough food; they
participate in individual and group therapy and noted no safety concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the secured and non-secured facility
occurred on 03/25/2025. The facility was found to be clean, neat, and furnished
appropriately to meet the needs of the youths. Bedrooms had clean sheets,
pillows, and comforters. Kitchen observed to have menu posted, plenty of food,
and very clean. The facility is currently adding a new commercial kitchen and
adding 20 beds to the detention unit, the expected completion date is September
2025.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
